text.text_translated: Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant that fewer children died at a young age. This led to rapid growth in the world population. Large families had more children who reached adulthood and had children of their own. In the 1960s, contraception became more common. Contraception is a method that stops a woman getting pregnant. After that, the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two.

feedback.feedback: The output is factually accurate and preserves all key details from the original. MeaningBERT (0.908) and BERTScore (0.9438) both exceed the required thresholds, and the text is correctly classified at the B1 level. Sentence splitting and connectors (Over the last two centuries, This led to, In the 1960s, After that) create a clear and logical flow. You also properly defined the keyword contraception. To refine further, consider reintroducing the word global for clarity (average number of babies per woman worldwide) and using the plural form ’women getting pregnant’ for greater grammatical consistency. You might also vary your vocabulary slightly by replacing ‘more common’ with alternatives like ‘wider’ or ‘greater’ availability to avoid repetition.

best_attempt.text_translated: Over the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant that fewer children died at a young age. This led to rapid growth in the world population. Large families had more children who reached adulthood and had children of their own. In the 1960s, contraception became more common. Contraception is a method that stops a woman getting pregnant. After that, the average number of babies per woman fell from six to two.
